column1: Wahiawa (Hawaiian: Wahiawā) is a census-designated place (CDP) in Honolulu County
column4: on the island of Oahu. It is in the Wahiawa District
column5: on the plateau or "central valley" between the two volcanic mountains that comprise the island. In Hawaiian
column6: wahi a wā means "space of the wa people". The population was 17
column7: 821 at the 2010 census.Lakes and reservoirs are rare in Hawaii
column8: and Wahiawa is unique in being surrounded on three sides by Lake Wilson (also known as Wahiawa Reservoir or Kaukonahua). The town must be accessed by either of two bridges on Kamehameha Highway (State Rte. 80) across the reservoir's narrow north and south arms. Outside of the reservoir
column9: the town used to be surrounded by military bases and agricultural fields
column10: but development is making its way up from the increasingly urbanized southern portion of the central plain. Still
column11: there are significant U.S. Army facilities in the area
column15: an Army training area extending into the hills south and east of town. Schofield Barracks alone is larger than Wahiawa CDP. Wahiawa is also home to the United States Navy's Naval Computer and Telecommunications Area Master Station Pacific.

column1: The U.S. postal codes for Wahiawa are 96786 and 96857.

column2: -158.022938).Vehicular routes to the North Shore from Wahiawa are Kamehameha Highway (State Rte. 80) to Haleiwa and Kaukonahua Road (State Rte. 801) to Waialua. Wheeler and Schofield are reached along Wilikina Drive (Wahiawa Bypass) (State Rte. 99)
column3: which bypasses Wahiawa from the south bridge
column4: a road that eventually connects to both Kamehameha Highway and Kaukonahua Road northwest of town. Kamehameha Highway continues south (as State Rte. 99) past Wheeler to Mililani Town. Interstate H-2 terminates at Wilikina Drive near the Kamehameha Highway intersection
column5: and is a less congested route southward to Mililani and beyond to Pearl City and Honolulu via Interstate H-1. Kunia Road (State Rte. 750) runs from Wilikina Drive
column6: between Schofield and Wheeler (on the bypass)
column7: then southward along the mostly still agricultural western side of the plain to Kunia and Waipahu beyond.

column1: The Honolulu Police Department operates the Wahiawa Substation in Wahiawā.A satellite gateway for the Iridium satellite phone network is operated by the DISA in Wahiawa.In the Hawaii State Legislature
column2: Wahiawā is part of Hawaii State House of Representatives district 39 (currently represented by Lei Learmont) and Hawaii State Senate district 22 (currently represented by Donovan Dela Cruz.) In the Honolulu City Council
column3: Wahiawā is part of district 2 (currently represented by Ernest Y. Martin.)

column1: The Hawaiʻi State Department of Education operates Wahiawa CDP's public schools.Elementary schools in the CDP include ʻIliahi
column3: and Wahiawā. Wahiawā Middle School is adjacent to but not in the CDP
column4: while Leilehua High School is in the CDP.

column1: Five other schools have Wahiawa postal addresses but are outside the CDP: Samuel K. Solomon Elementary School and Daniel K. Inouye (formerly Hale Kula) Elementary School in Schofield Barracks CDP
column2: Helemano Elementary School in Whitmore Village CDP
column3: and Major Sheldon Wheeler Elementary School and Major Sheldon Wheeler Middle School in the Wheeler Air Force Base CDP and on Wheeler Army Airfield.
